page.title: 04STAFFS POLICE DOG TRAINING
page.content: The Staffordshire Police Force brought in dogs in about 1950. They advertised for either breeding dogs or puppies. They use some Labradors but they mostly use Alsatians, because they are obedient and adapt well from being a pet at home to being a police dog. They mainly use the dogs for tracking and attacking. The dogs have special trainers called Â£Handlers'. The handlers keep the dogs at home. They put the dogs through the necessary training of how to obey. They teach them to sniff out explosives, drugs, corpses and criminals. On OPEN DAYS the dogs usually go over ramps , through circles , over hurdles and through a fire hoop. Also there is a show of obedience. When the dog gets too old to work then his handler can keep him.
